summary: G. Robert Blakey was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978, listing Blakey's name, salary, and employment dates. These documents confirm his employment with the committee during that period.
significance: The documents indicate that G. Robert Blakey was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations, likely involved in the investigation of the JFK assassination, though the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents.
